intro: Linaria patula, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy yellow-orange flowers with two lips, which are characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Linaria patula is known for its adaptability to various soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
